criteria: Explanation of How Details Support the Main Idea
descriptions: Fails to identify the main idea of the text.
Struggles to identify the main idea; provides an inaccurate or irrelevant idea.
Identifies a main idea, but it is vague or not fully supported by the text.
Identifies the main idea of the text, but explanation lacks depth or clarity.
Clearly identifies the main idea of the text with a reasonable explanation.
Accurately and Insightfully identifies the main idea of the text, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding.
Unable to recount any key details from the text.
Recounts very few key details, and they may be inaccurate or irrelevant.
Recounts some key details, but misses important information or includes irrelevant details.
Recounts most of the key details from the text, with minor omissions or inaccuracies.
Accurately recounts the key details from the text.
Masterfully recounts the key details from the text, demonstrating thorough recall and understanding.
Provides no explanation of how the details support the main idea.
Attempts to explain the connection, but explanation is unclear, inaccurate, or missing.
Provides a weak or superficial explanation of how the details support the main idea.
Explains how some of the key details support the main idea, but the connection is not always clear or convincing.
Clearly explains how the key details support the main idea, providing relevant evidence from the text.
Insightfully explains how the key details support the main idea, demonstrating a deep understanding of the text's structure and purpose.
